summary: This is a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request from New York Times reporter Danielle Ivory to the Bureau of Prisons, seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The request specifically asks for phone logs, email correspondence, visitor logs, and approved contact lists from Epstein's time in custody.

persons.name: Danielle Ivory
persons.context: New York Times reporter who submitted the FOIA request to the Bureau of Prisons seeking records about Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FOIA request; an accused sex trafficker who died while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center while in federal custody.

keyFacts: The New York Times submitted a FOIA request on December 12, 2019, seeking comprehensive records about Jeffrey Epstein's time at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The request specifically seeks Epstein's phone call logs, email correspondence, visitor logs, and approved contact lists while he was incarcerated.
Jeffrey Epstein died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, while in federal custody.
The requester argues there is extreme public interest in these records due to Epstein's death in custody and the allegations of sexual abuse involving numerous women and underage girls.
The FOIA request cites legal precedents and the FOIA Improvement Act of 2016 to support the argument for disclosure of the records.
